com.zcking.furyengine.engine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zcking.furyengine.engine.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The core of the fury engine. This class should only be instantiated once, and is used to "play" an instance of a game, where a game is an implementation of the IGameLogic. The core engine managed the main game loop, timing, window management, and game runtime.

                              int height,

        Deprecated. 
        Instantiates the game engine.
        Parameters:
        windowTitle - The text to display for the window title bar.
        width - The width of the window.
        height - The height of the window.
        vSync - Whether or not V-sync should be used for the display.
        gameLogic - The implemented game logic to run.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the game engine initialization fails.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the main game loop thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the game engine. Should be called after start(). Automatically performs game engine cleanup on the termination of the engine.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • init

        protected void init()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes the display/window, the game timer, mouse input, and game logic.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any of the initialization steps fails.
